FuncDef:
The mpls command enables MPLS on the local node and displays the MPLS view.
The undo mpls command deletes the MPLS configurations.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, MPLS is not enabled on a node.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You need to run the mpls command on a network where MPLS services need to be deployed.
You can run other commands associated with MPLS only after running the mpls command.
Configuration Impact
After the mpls command is run, MPLS is enabled globally and the MPLS view is displayed.
Follow-up Procedure
You can perform other configurations of MPLS.
Precautions
The undo mpls command in the system view deletes MPLS settings, except for MPLS LSR IDs, which are configured in the system and interface views.
